III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Program statement
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents’ needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
2

Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On an unknown date around 2 months ago, a staff touched a
youth's private area.
Investigation Complainant was interviewed face to face at the facility on
April 16, 2024, and reported there was no additional
information.
Youth A was interviewed at the Tuscola County Child
Advocacy Center (CAC) on April 16, 2024, by Interviewer
while DHHS Worker, Officer, and I observed. Youth A reported
he does not like Staff 1 because Staff 1 “does too much.” Youth A
described “too much” as, Staff 1 continuing to talk with Youth A
when Youth A is upset and would rather just sit down and not talk.
Youth A described about one month ago when running outside the
door by the bathrooms Staff 1 accidently touched Youth A’s body
part he uses to go to the bathroom. Youth A stated he bumped
into Staff 1 on accident. Youth A reported he feels it was an
accident Staff 1 touched him because when Youth A told Staff 1
he touched him Staff 1 did not know he touched him. Youth A
stated he had clothes on, it only happened one time and Staff 1
did not say anything to Youth A. Youth A denied any other youth
or staff being around. Youth A described the incident as a “bump
and done,” meaning it lasted only a second. Youth A reported he
feels safe at the facility.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on April
16, 2024. Youth A was unaware I had earlier observed his
interview at the CAC. Youth A reported he felt safe at the facility
and did not have any concerns with staff or youth.
Youth B was interviewed via Teams on April 29, 2024, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker and Officer who were at the
facility. Youth B reported he has been at the facility for about one
and a half years. Youth B reported Staff 1 was not at the facility
very long and is no longer working because of some “weird shit.”
Youth B stated Youth A said Staff 1 touched his penis. Youth B
reported at first, he thought Youth A was joking but Youth A said
he was being real, and Staff 1 needs to go to prison. Youth B
stated he could not recall when Youth A told him or if there were
other staff around to hear what Youth A said. Youth B denied
ever seeing Staff 1 touch Youth A or be inappropriate with any of
the youths. Youth B reported feeling safe at the facility.
Youth C was interviewed via Teams on April 29, 2024, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker and Officer who were at the
3

facility. Youth C reported he has not seen Staff 1 lately and
heard from other youth Staff 1 was on administrative leave
because of an altercation with Youth A. Youth C denied Youth A
ever saying anything to him about Staff 1 touching his penis or
hearing Youth A say anything to anyone about Staff 1. Youth C
described Staff 1 as quiet. Youth C denied seeing Staff 1 hurt
youth or touch youth on their bodies where he should not. Youth
C denied ever seeing Youth A and Staff 1 together on the unit.
Youth C reported he feels safe at the facility.
Staff 1 was interviewed via Teams on April 29, 2024, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker and Officer who were at the
facility. Staff 1 stated he was aware of the allegations due to
being on leave until the investigation was completed. Staff 1
denied the allegations saying he had no idea why the allegation
would have been made. Staff 1 reported he has only worked with
Youth A two or three times. Staff 1 stated he does not recall a
time he was ever alone with Youth A. Staff 1 described an
incident when Youth A ran off the unit out a door, but Staff 1 did
not follow Youth A out of the building, a different staff followed
Youth A. Staff 1 stated he believed this occurred in February and
he could not recall who the staff was that ran out of the building
following Youth A. Staff 1 reported Youth A never told him he
touched his penis.
Staff 2 was interviewed via telephone on May 13, 2024, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 2 described being
swapped out with Staff 1 when Youth A said, “hell no, he touched
my dick.” Staff 2 stated Youth A did not offer any more details or
say anything else regarding Staff 1. Staff 2 reported Youth A was
laughing and saying it in a joking way. Staff 2 denied ever seeing
Staff 1 touch Youth A or any youth. Staff 2 stated she does not
have any concerns with Staff 1.
Video Reviewed
Video footage of 03/26/2024 in the unit was reviewed on May 3,
2024. Youth A is seen walking out of the unit through a door near
where Staff 1 is standing. Staff 1 has contact with Youth A but
Staff 1’s hands are never seen touching Youth A below the waist.
Documents Reviewed:
• Staff 1’s personnel file had one write up not related to
being inappropriate with youth.
• Wolverine Human Services Service Philosophy,
Modalities and Interventions Policy states, Wolverine
4

Human Services has a zero tolerance for rape, sexual
abuse, sexual harassment, and threats to clients.
• Written statement from Staff 2 documenting what she
heard Youth A say about Staff 1. Statement was
consistent with Youth A and Staff 2’s interviews.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as per staff and youth
interviews and video review, Staff 1 did not touch Youth A’s penis.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
